title: CE60117: Theoretical Geomechanics - Quick Facts
text:
CE60117
Course name | Theoretical Geomechanics
Offered by | Civil Engineering
Credits | 3
L-T-P | 3-0-0
Previous Year Grade Distribution
{{{grades}}}
Semester | Autumn

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Introduction (review of stress and effective stress, analysis of deformation and strain, states of stress and strain, constitutive relations); Equilibrium and compatibility, general theorems, Drained and undrained loading, state boundary surface, plastic flow, yield and hardening; Failure theorems for soils; Failure and plastic flow at critical state (p,q,and v); Associative and non-associative flow, residual strength; Anisotropic compressions; Ideal elastic behaviour - two and three dimensional systems; Theorems of plastic collapse and their application to soil-structure interaction; Elastoplastic modelling of soils; Rheological models; Nonlinear viscoelasticity; Problems and solutions.
